intro: Gouania cupuliflora, commonly known as the cup-shaped gouania, is a species of flowering plant in the family Polygonaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, where it typically grows in moist, shaded environments. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and distinctive, cup-shaped inflorescences that bear small, white flowers. It is often found in forest understories and is adapted to thrive in humid, nutrient-rich soils. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological role in its native habitats.
